data.text: @vijucat @FlyingBoi @tripperhead I would also be interested in looking at excess death data (to sidestep the whole dying with/of covid debate), and compare the excess deaths of US last 20/21 and when they had a swine flu pandemic in 2009
@ChefMiew @FlyingBoi @tripperhead I quickly checked US numbers and you were right : COVID deaths were 10X the flu numbers. Assuming they didn't polish the numbers, of course.

@FlyingBoi @vijucat @tripperhead Ah yes. Dying WITH Covid or dying OF Covid.

What does excess death data look like? 

E.g. Compared against 2009, when there was an influenza pandemic

https://t.co/aOAF5YGBUv
@ChefMiew @vijucat @tripperhead Having said that, diabetes is a probably among locals, and it being one of the highest co-morbidities with covid deaths, it ain't looking great

@ChefMiew @vijucat @tripperhead Just have a look for example at UK death statistics from the end of last year. Only about 17% were solely covid caused deaths. However that's not widely reported or emphasised.

@ChefMiew @FlyingBoi @tripperhead Good point! I'm repeating myself, but my key point is to question whether the numbers are astronomical enough to justify the narrative that we are in "wartime". I'm afraid the government is going to misuse the panic.
@roygrubb @tripperhead Your readiness to start mocking instead of giving the benefit of doubt or asking further questions to clarify intent is on you. You do you :)
